questions.title: Primary Use Case
questions.text: What is the primary use case for this skill?

choices.text: Focus on the most common workflow patterns that engineers encounter daily
Focus on advanced/niche patterns for experienced engineers
Cover both common and advanced patterns with equal depth
Other (please specify)

refinements.title: Priority Workflow Patterns
refinements.text: Since you chose to focus on common workflow patterns, which should be primary: CRUD operations, batch processing, event-driven workflows, or scheduled tasks?

choices.text: CRUD and event-driven as primary; batch and scheduled as secondary
Equal coverage for all four patterns
CRUD as primary; all others as secondary
Other (please specify)

questions.title: Target Expertise Level
questions.text: What level of expertise should this skill assume?

choices.text: Beginner — needs step-by-step guidance on fundamentals
Intermediate — familiar with basic concepts but needs guidance on best practices and edge cases
Advanced — already knows best practices, needs deep domain-specific insight
Other (please specify)

refinements.title: Prerequisite Checks for Intermediate Readers
refinements.text: For intermediate-level guidance, should the skill include a self-assessment checklist or assume readers can gauge their own readiness?

choices.text: Include a brief prerequisites section with self-assessment checklist
Assume readers can self-assess; no prerequisites section
Include prerequisites as a collapsible/optional section
Other (please specify)

questions.title: Greenfield vs Brownfield Coverage
questions.text: Should this skill cover both greenfield and brownfield scenarios?

choices.text: Greenfield only — new projects from scratch
Both, with emphasis on greenfield but include migration guidance for existing systems
Both with equal depth
Other (please specify)

questions.answer_text: Both, with emphasis on greenfield but include migration guidance for existing systems.

questions.title: Architectural Pattern Priority
questions.text: What architectural patterns should be prioritized?

choices.text: Start with the most widely adopted patterns, then layer in alternatives for specific constraints
Cover all patterns equally and let the reader choose
Focus on opinionated best-practice patterns only
Other (please specify)

questions.answer_text: Start with the most widely adopted patterns, then layer in alternatives for specific constraints.

questions.title: Technology-Specific vs Agnostic Guidance
questions.text: How should the skill handle technology-specific vs technology-agnostic guidance?

choices.text: Lead with technology-agnostic principles, then provide concrete examples for the most common tools
Organize entirely by technology/tool
Technology-agnostic only — no tool-specific examples
Other (please specify)

refinements.title: Tool Selection Decision Matrix
refinements.text: When presenting technology-agnostic patterns, should the skill provide a decision matrix for choosing specific tools, or keep tool recommendations out of the main guidance entirely?

choices.text: Include a decision matrix in references, with brief tool mentions in the main skill
Keep all tool recommendations in references only
Include tool recommendations inline with each pattern
Other (please specify)

questions.title: Performance Optimization Placement
questions.text: Should performance optimization be covered in the main skill or references?

choices.text: Cover key performance principles in SKILL.md, detailed optimization in references
All performance content in references only
Inline performance guidance alongside each pattern
Other (please specify)

questions.title: Code Example Depth

choices.text: Copy-paste-ready templates for the most common patterns
Pseudocode/conceptual examples only
Full working examples with test harnesses
Other (please specify)
